thesis.description: As war approached, Kemalist Turkey sought safety through collective security arrangements. Despite her proclamation of non-belligerency in 1939, she remained during the first phase of the world conflict a willing ally of Britain and France. In the second period she became increasingly cautious, and in the third (that of the Axis zenith) she embraced neutrality. From early in 1943 until the declaration of war, she returned to a pro-Allied partiality, although this was much complicated by Russian presence among the Allies. Indeed, throughout the war her main fear was of Soviet imperialism.
thesis.creator: Romeril, Paul. E.
thesis.subject: Islamic Studies.
thesis.title: War diplomacy and the Turkish Republic: a study in neutrality.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: “Shock is a depression of the vital powers, induced suddenly by external injury and essentially dependent on loss of innervation. It bears the same relation to the nervous system as syncope to the vascular. In the one case, the result is caused by a diminution of the nervous fluid, in the other, by a diminution of the blood.” (94). This thought of Dr. Samuel Gross, 1872, pathologist and surgeon, marks the beginning of the investigation of shock mechanism.
thesis.creator: Richards, Terence. A.
thesis.subject: Experimental Surgery.
thesis.title: The results of treatment of haemorrhagic shock on survival, blood volumes and metabolism.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: For many years casein was believed to be a homogenous protein. However, early work with fractional precipitation methods showed that casein was not a single protein, and later, electrophoretic studies proved conclusively that casein is composed or at least three tractions. The tractions were designated as alpha-, beta- and gamma-casein. The physical properties and the composition or the three tractions have been investigated in some detail, but there has been much controversy as to the presence or carbohydrate in casein.
thesis.creator: Reynolds, Lincoln. M.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Studies on the constitution of casein.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The reductive cleavage of spruce wood lignosulphonic acids by sodium in liquid ammonia was studied with the object of determining the chemical nature of the cleavage products. After isolating the lignin with only a little chemical change, it was sulphonated with aqueous sodium bisulphite at pH 5 and 100° to yield an insoluble Stage I (83%) and a soluble Stage I lignosulphonate. The insoluble Stage I lignosulphonic acid was converted to a soluble Stage II product by autohydrolysis under mild conditions. Methylation with diazomethane was used to show that this conversion did not involve the production of free phenolic groups in the lignosulphonic acid.
thesis.creator: Read, Dale. W.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: The degradation of lignosulphonates with sodium in liquid ammonia.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Agricultural land use is analysed in an area of northwestern New Brunswick which includes nearly all cleared land in Carleton, Victoria, arid Madawaska counties. Of the major physiographic regions which comprise the area, the intervals and terraces along the St. John and its larger tributaries, the uplands of western Carleton county, and the area centering on Grand Falls are the beat suited agriculturally, and have favoured potato specialization since the early 1900’s. Elsewhere, mixed farming pertains, often at subsistence or part-time levels.
thesis.creator: Raymond, Charles. W.
thesis.subject: Geography.
thesis.title: A land use survey of the Upper St. John River Valley in New Brunswick.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The experimental work of this thesis can be divided into two distinct parts. The first part is a continuation of the investigation of the isotopic exchange reaction between x-iodostearic acid monolayers and substrate iodide ions. The second part is a study of the effect of various substituents in the hydrocarbon chain of stearic acid on the mechanical properties of the respective monolayers.
thesis.creator: Ramaradhya, J.M.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Studies of Some Physical and Chemical Properties of Unimolecular Films.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Pulp and paper manufacturing is one of Canada's best known industries, but the spectacular woods operation of British Columbia seem largely to overshadow the equally significant forest industries of eastern Canada, particularly in popular accounts of Canadian manufacturing. It was therefore with great interest and some trepidation that the writer approached the problem of preparing a thesis on a topic which was to him, a new arrival from England, beyond the range of his experience or knowledge.
thesis.creator: Power, G.C.
thesis.subject: Geography.
thesis.title: an Analysis of Geographical Factors Determining the Northern Limits of the Pulp and Paper Industry in Northern Ontario.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Atlantic salmon (Salmo salar Linn.) have been known to inhabit the rivers flowing north into Ungava Bay for many years. In spite of their importance no biological investigation of the populations has previously been carried out. These populations are of particular interest as it is here that the salmon reaches the most northerly extent of its range in eastern Canada. [...]
thesis.creator: Power, Geoffrey.
thesis.subject: Zoology.
thesis.title: Studies on the Atlantic Salmon (Salmo Salar Linn.) of Sub-Arctic Canada.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The author spent the period August 1957 to August 1958, at Lake Hazen, Ellesmere Island, N.W.T., as a member of "Operation Hazen." "Operation Hazen" was organized as part of the Canadian International Geophysical Year Programme, to carry out meteorological, glaciological, and geological work over two summers and one winter, and was sponsored by the Defence Research Board of Canada.
thesis.creator: Powell, John Martin.
thesis.subject: Geography.
thesis.title: the Climatic Conditions Affecting the Vegetation of the Lake Hazen Area, Ellesmere Island, N.W.T.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: It has been repeatedly demonstrated that the concentration of certain enzymes in the serum and muscle of patients with muscular dystrophy is not normal. Although this abnormality is not specific for this disease, nevertheless it can be used to confirm diagnosis of muscular dystrophy. We have used the ethyl ester of gamma butyrobetaine (gBBE) in an attempt to reproduce the abnormalities seen in muscular dystrophy. [...]
thesis.creator: Powell, E.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: the Effect of Intramuscular Injections of gBBE on Enzyme Movement.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The dissertation concerns itself with changes in Canadian labour force participation rates for men and women which occurred during the post-war period or, more specifically, from mid-1946 to mid-1958. The terms of reference are to find out how the rates changed and why did the changes occur.
thesis.creator: Polianski, Alexei Nicholas.
thesis.subject: Economics and Political Science.
thesis.title: Changes in Canadian Labour Force Participation Rates 1946-58 (a Socio-Economic Study of the Canadian Labour Market).
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

degree.name: Master of Arts
degree.discipline: Department of Economics and Political Science

thesis.description: Casein was first recognized as a component of milk by Scheele in 1780. For many years casein was regarded as a chemical individual remarkable among proteins for its ease of isolation in a relatively pure state, and for this reason has probably been the subject of more investigations than any other protein.
thesis.creator: Pilson, Michael Edward Quinton.
thesis.subject: Agricultural Chemistry.
thesis.title: Studies on Casein.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Venturia inaequalis (Cke.) Wint. is the incitant of apple scab, a disease of great economic importance throughout the world. This pathogen, in the early stages of infection, is confined to the area between the cuticle and the epidermis of the host and thrives there in intimate contact with these layers. This rather peculiar growth habit seems to indicate that lipids might have an important role in determining the host specificity and the pathogenicity of V. inaequalis. [...]
thesis.creator: Phillips, C.O. Douglas.
thesis.subject: Plant Pathology.
thesis.title: the Nutrition of Venturia Inaequalis (CKE.) Wint.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Massive and disseminated sulphides occur at Kennco Clearwater deposit and the Caribou Ore Body. The geological setting and mineralogy of the Kennco Clearwater deposit were studied in the field and in thin and polished sections, and wall rock alteration of both deposits was studied by X-ray diffraction.
thesis.creator: Petruk, William
thesis.subject: Geological Science.
thesis.title: The Clearwater Copper-Zinc Deposit and its Setting, with a Special Study of Mineral Zoning around such Deposits
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Among the many recent developments in chemical engineering operations, few are more characteristic of the post-war technology than the new contacting techniques. Primarily designed to effect intimate contact between a continuous fluid phase, and a finely sub-divided solid or liquid dispersed phase, they are finding application in a rapidly increasing number of physical and chemical processes.
thesis.creator: Pasternak, I.S.
thesis.subject: Chemical Engineering.
thesis.title: Turbulent Convective Heat and Mass Transfer from Stationary and Accelerating Particles.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The islet like structures in the pancreas were first noted by Langerhans (1869) and later named after him by Laguesse (1893). That the islets produce a substance which plays a vital role in carbohydrate metabolism was suggested by subsequent investigations (Von Mering & Minkowski, 1890; Laguesse, 1893; Diamare, 1899). This substance was extracted and named 'Isletin' by Banting & Best (1922) and was found to be effective in controlling diabetes in depancreatized dogs and humans suffering from natural diabetes.
thesis.creator: Parakkal, Paul F.
thesis.subject: Zoology.
thesis.title: Regional Differences in the Pancreas of the Albino Mouse (Mus musculus albinus) as Indicated by the Distribution of the Islets of Langerhans and of Alpha and Beta Cells.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: In 1939 Rossby published a theory of wave motion in the atmosphere which formed the basis of later work on this subject. One year later Haurwitz extended the theory to waves of finite lateral extent and to wave motion on a spherical earth. During the next ten years various investigators, including Rossby, developed the theory further, attempting to approximate more closely the baroclinic nature of the atmosphere. [...]
thesis.creator: Page, D.E.
thesis.subject: Meteorology.
thesis.title: Long Waves in the Ferrel Westerlies During December 1958.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The key to an understanding of the mechanism of many complex reactions came in 1925. In that year Sir Hugh Taylor (1) provided evidence which suggested that atoms and radicals might play important parts as chain carriers in many chemical reactions. Soon after, Rice and his collaborators (2) used Paneth’s (3) metallic mirror test to establish that the thermal decomposition of a number of organic compounds involves these transient species. Using simple elementary reactions involving atoms and free radicals, Rice and Herzfeld were able to devise successful mechanisms for many complex organic decomposition reactions.
thesis.creator: Ogryzlo, Elmer. A.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: The use of an isothermal calorimetric detector for the study of electrically discharged O2 and the reaction of O-atoms with NO.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: In this thesis, we assume a fixed space has been chosen once and for all and "set" will mean subset of that fixed space. Similarly "system" will refer to collection of subsets of that fixed space. Measure theoretic formulae acquire greater symmetry if we adopt Picone e Viola's notation [6] for union and intersection. The + and E signs are used for unions with + and Ec when these are over disjoint sets; while simple juxtaposition and TT are used for intersection.
thesis.creator: Normand, Gerald. L.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: An inductive method for the extension of measures.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: In a previous study of the two rabbit Trichostrongyles, Trichostrongylus retortaeformis (Zader, 1800) and Graphidium strigosum (Dujardin, 1845), the writer studied under laboratory conditions, the influence of the main environmental factors on the free-living stages of these nematodes. In the present work, a closer examination of the micro-environments of the infective and adult stages of these worms has been attempted. The term micro-environment is used in this study to denote the immediate surrounding of the worm.
thesis.creator: Nnochiri, Enyinnaya.
thesis.subject: Parasitology.
thesis.title: Studies on the micro-environment of rabbit trichostrongyles.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The method to discover the more important factors causing the movements in income-velocity is to examine the determinants of the demand for money. In the cash balance terminology of the Cambridge equation, k=M/Y real money balances are set equal to real monetary income times a number, k. The k, in the cash balance equation is the reciprocal of velocity. Any analysis in terms of the proportion that desired cash balances bear to income or total transactions can easily be restated in terms of the velocity of money.
thesis.creator: Nixon, Justin. W.
thesis.subject: Economics.
thesis.title: Monetary velocity in the Canadian economy.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Present knowledge of the fundamental function of the nephron and its role in urine formation and elimination is still incomplete. The nephron bas been subdivided into a standard pattern of segments on the basis of its morphology, and various functions were ascribed to each of the segments through the results of physiological experiments (Richards, 1929). The modern expanded knowledge in the fields of physiology and biochemistry has made it apparent that the conventional segments are further subdivided into zones which divide the labour of urine formation, reabsorption and excretion.
thesis.creator: Nejedly, Vladislava. J.
thesis.subject: Zoology.
thesis.title: Histological study of the proximal convoluted tubule in the developing mouse kidney.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The mosque (masjid) as the center of Muslim higher education was, from the latter part of the fifth centuries hijri (circa, eleventh centuries A.D.), being gradually replaced by the madrasah. In less than a hundred and fifty years after the establishment of the first madrasah in Khurasan, this institution became the most widespread educational system of higher learning in the Muslim world.
thesis.creator: Nashshabah, Hisam. A.
thesis.subject: Islamic Studies.
thesis.title: Al-Madrasah Al-Mushtansiriyah in Baghdad: a study of Muslim educational institutions.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: An ascaroid worm is common in the stomach of various seals in the eastern North Atlantic Ocean. Its infective larva occurs in a variety of ground fish in the Gulf of St. Lawrence and the seals become infected by eating the infected fish. As the incomplete knowledge of this nematode has caused considerable confusion over its nomenclature and relationships, it is proposed to make it the type species of the new genus Phocanema.
thesis.creator: Myers, Betty-June.
thesis.subject: Parasitology.
thesis.title: A revision of the subfamily Anisakinae with special reference to Porrocaecum decipiens and its affinities.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Xanthate methyl esters of cellulose have great importance for the cellophane and viscose rayon industries. Though these industrial processes are well developed, the chemistry involved is still not fully understood, despite the considerable time and effort spent to solve this problem. The ultimate aim of the present research, the latest of several devoted to the subject, was to provide background information concerning the location and chemistry of the xanthate groups in cellulose xanthate.
thesis.creator: Muller, Thomas. E.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Oxidation of xanthate methyl esters of glucose derivatives.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.
